climbs.name: Where Brownies Dare
climbs.fa: Ernie Ale, Bruce Burns & Kevin Mills, June 1988

content.description: Climb a small flake to a two bolt face. Bolted anchor on top.
content.protection: Try to fiddle something in before you get to the two bolts on the face.
content.location: Middle of the face w/Barretts and Point Break.

content.description: This route climbs the steep pillar of rock to the right of Bush Driver, directly up to the sundeck.
content.protection: Bolts only.  5 bolts to 2 bolt anchor.

content.description:
Climb the face five feet to the right of the chimney start of

Boost for the Beginner

.  Pass one bolt on the face to the top.

Can be toproped from the same location as Boost for the Beginner and Don't Overlook
content.location: West end of Unreported Rock's southe face

content.description:
From the sundeck above

Bush Driver

step all the way to the left and enter the chimney above the bombay chasm.  Climb the chimney to a crack to the top, build your own anchor.

If you're careful, you can combine Bush Driver and this route without intolerable rope drag with a 60m rope.
content.protection: big bro?  I had nothing bigger than a #3 camalot and had to run out the first 15 feet.  a #5 might have made that ten feet.  placements low are deep in the chimney.
content.location: At the top of Bush Driver

content.description:
This is the left slanting crack on the last climbable rock on the right side of the formation.  There are about two handjams and then some summit type jugs to pull over onto the top.

Not a bomb, but not a full on 1 either.  I'll go .7249 stars.
content.protection: A cam or two in the 1" - 2" range.  No fixed anchors on top, but hey, you are only 17 feet off the ground anyway.
content.location: Look for the last climbable crack on the far right end of the formation.  Blocky start leads to two handjams then a steep and juggy move right.  Walk off to climbers right.

content.description: Bolted face climb to the right of Where Brownies Dare.  Starts on the right, and traveres to the left.
content.protection: 3 bolts, one FP , and a bolted anchor on top.

content.description:
After climbing

Squeeze, Pull, and Yank

traverse to the left and set up a top anchor, rap down to the Sundeck, and climb the platy face to the left of the chimney.

The rock is loose and crumbly and had not been climbed enough to clean up.

You could climb this straight off the Sundeck, but the rock is poor enough that it would be very dangerous. No pro
content.location: The wall going up from the left end of the sundeck

climbs.name: Frank's Sandwich
climbs.fa: Dave Vaught, Tucker Tech,  Todd Gordon, Greg Epperson

content.description: A top rope that climbs the obvious features between Barrett's and Where Brownies Dare.
content.protection: tope rope off of the bolted anchor on the ledge.

content.description:
Just a few feet to the left of The Unreported, this rout follows the face to the anchors you used to belay at the top of The Unreported.

Start behind a bush on the ramp that you use to down-climb off the top of Unreported Rock.
content.location: Western-most route on the south face of Unreported Rock

content.description:
A chimney start to climb face and crack to a nice ledge (called "The Sundeck").  From here, you can set up a belay, or climb either

Squeeze, Pull, and Yank

(5.7), or

Plates and Pockets

(5.7 X/no pro).

Lots of rope drag if you continue up the chimney.
content.location: See beta photo for area.  The crack/gully clearly leads to the large, flat sundeck. Hard to miss.

content.description: Start just right of Point Break in a right leaning crack that Y's out at the top.  Either exit is fine.  Pretty good rock and a nice but short route.
content.protection: A couple to few cams in the small to medium range and some stoppers.  It does not seem to take pro all that well, or we had the wrong rack.
content.location: First crack line right of Point Break.  Look for the short crack that Y's at the top.  Walk off to climbers right.

climbs.name: Brain Tumor
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Kelly Vaught, Frank Bentwood, Greg Epperson, Nick Patrick

content.description: This route is a fairly scabby face climb between Boost For The Beginner and Bush Driver.  It goes up a scoop of rock and sorta wanders right then back left following some bolts over grainy terrain.  Not a bomb, but not a full one star route either.  I'll go .826 stars.
content.protection: 5 bolts, one fixed pin to bolted anchor.
content.location: Take the face between Boost for the Beginner and Bush Driver.  Sorta obvious and you will see the bolt out right from the starting block behind a cat claw bush.  Bolt anchor at the top.

content.description:
This is the large-ish chimney to the right of a dike near the western end of the Unreported Rock formation.

Start up the chimney, shortly stepping out to the left onto the face and the dike, follow the face between two dikes to the top.

You can toprope The Unreported and Don't Overlook from the same anchor you build for this route.
content.protection: Standard rack and one bolt.  I placed one pink tricam low and pro above is sparse, but the climbing is easy.
content.location: Far west end of the south face of Unreported Rock.  Nice and sunny.

content.description: Bolted sport climb just left of Where Brownies Dare
